conditions.name: ALT/AST Elevation (Moderate)
conditions.description: Alanine or Aspartate aminotransferase elevation greater than 3 times and less than or equal to 5 times the upper limit of normal.

conditions.name: ALT/AST Elevation (Severe)
conditions.description: Alanine or Aspartate aminotransferase elevation greater than 5 times the upper limit of normal.

conditions.name: Hemoglobin Decrease
conditions.description: Clinically significant decrease in hemoglobin from baseline.

conditions.name: Platelet Decrease
conditions.description: Clinically significant decrease in platelets from baseline.

conditions.name: Neutrophil Decrease
conditions.description: Clinically significant decrease in neutrophils from baseline.
conditions.text: > 30% ↓ from baseline and neutrophils below reference range

conditions.name: Potential Liver Injury
conditions.description: Elevated bilirubin accompanied by elevated ALT, indicative of potential liver injury.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN

conditions.name: Neurological Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening by Adverse Events or by neurologic physical exam assessment.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening

conditions.name: Safety Concerns Pre-Titration
conditions.description: Safety concerns that, in the opinion of the Investigator(s) and/or Alexion, may place participants at undue risk for dose titration.
conditions.text: Safety concerns that may place participants at undue risk

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30mg
transitionRules.text: On Day 29, increase dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day, unless there are safety concerns. SRC to review safety data through Day 23 prior to titration.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Moderate ALT/AST Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT/AST > 3x ULN and <= 5x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe ALT/AST Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT/AST > 5x ULN, discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Hematologic Abnormalities
transitionRules.text: If Hemoglobin, Platelets, or Neutrophils decrease beyond threshold, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Potential Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN with ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic/Psychiatric Worsening
transitionRules.text: Upon neurologic or psychiatric worsening, Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease).

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Serious Hypersensitivity
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for a serious hypersensitivity reaction.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe Infection
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for a severe uncontrolled infection.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Disallowed Medication
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for use of disallowed medication.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor or Investigator Study Termination
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The study site or entire study may be closed early by Alexion or the Investigator for reasons such as non-compliance, inadequate recruitment, or discontinuation of study intervention development.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point on Day 29 to titrate dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day, based on SRC review of safety data through Day 23.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Liver Safety Dose Modification
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing monitoring of liver function tests to determine if dose modification (interruption or discontinuation) is required.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Hematology Safety Dose Modification
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing monitoring of complete blood count to determine if dose reduction is required.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Neurologic and Psychiatric Safety Dose Modification
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing monitoring for neurologic or psychiatric worsening to determine if dose modification is required.
